pr_title: GRAPHICS: Optimized ManagedSurface::blendBlitFrom replacement for TransparentSurface::blit
pr_body:
ManagedSurface::blendBlitFrom is a replacement for TransparentSurface::blit now. Both have been optimized and can optionally decide to use SIMD vector extensions if they are present on your CPU. They both use a function in blit.h called BlendBlit::blit. ManagedSurface::blendBlitFrom's prototype was changed from TransparentSurface::bit's to be better inline with the rest of ManagedSurface's blit member functions and to be a little more clear.

The Sword25 engine now uses ManagedSurface and blendBlitFrom instead of TransparentSurface.

The OSystem layer now has new features to indicate the presence of a CPU extension (kFeatureSSE2, etc). x86 detection and NEON detection for aarch64 is done in the BaseBackend class. PowerPC simd features are detected by the platform backends as detection there works better for PowerPC (note PowerPC hasn't been optimized for yet, only the PPC SIMD feature exists atm).

The configure script now has new features to enable these SIMD vector extensions. They are:
  --enable-ext-sse2 --enable-ext-neon --enable-ext-avx2
and are disabled by default. They all pass architecture flags to gcc, and define SCUMMVM_SSE2/NEON/AVX2 in config.
Do note that without --enable-optimizations, that the intrinsics actually will make the program slower.

On my machines, the new SIMDless code is marginally faster, SSE2 code is around 1.2x faster, NEON code is around 2.2x faster, and AVX2 code is around 2.5x faster.

pr_title: AGS: NEON and SSE2 blending and blitting optimizations
pr_body:
Wrote better and more optimized blending/blitting functions for ags's
allegro library. These are targeted mainly towards cpus with SSE2 or NEON,
but optimizations have also been made to the old code that was for any cpu.
